title.narrative: PA contribution to Uganda via Sida HPA

description.narrative: The proposed project will enable Oxfam to kick -start the delivery of an integrated Water Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH), Emergency Food Security and Vulnerable Livelihoods (EFSVL) Sexual and Gender Based Violence (SGBV) and Protection intervention in a way that promotes the inherent capacities of the affected people to sustainably respond to the challenges. The objective of the Oxfam Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) refugee response is to save lives, reduce suffering, promote human dignity and enhance resilience of the refugees (female and male) and host community members in Kyaka II in south west Uganda. Expected Results 1 1.1 Increased safe and equal access to portable water for an estimated 10,000 DRC refugee new arrivals and 3000 individuals from host communities. 1.2 Improved safe access to gender and culturally appropriate and sustainable sanitation facilities for an estimated 8,000 DRC refugee new arrivals and 2,400 individuals from host communities 1.3 Increased awareness of positive hygiene practices by women, men, girls, and boys through community engagement among estimated 14,000 DRC refugees new arrivals and 4,000 individuals from host communities 2.1 Enhanced capacity of women, girls, men, and boys among estimated 20,000 DRC refugee new arrivals and 6,000 individuals from host communities to identify, prevent, and mitigate risk of SGBV 2.2 Refugees and host communities mobilised and supported to ensure peaceful co -existence and sharing of resources including access to water, land for farming, food, fuel wood and building poles 3.1 Increased income earning opportunities for estimated 6,000 (1200 HouseHolds) DRC refugee new arrivals and 1,000 (200 HHs) individuals from host communities 3.2 Enhanced food production capacities for estimated 6,000 (1,200 HHs) DRC refugee new arrivals and 1,000 (200 HHs) individuals from host communities
